intro: Dichaelia macra, commonly known as the large-flowered dichaelia, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking, large yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. Dichaelia macra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
